primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades human history to unveil the true reality of His sovereignty over worldly empires and to vindicate His faithful servants.

subject.identificatie: God (The Most High / The Power invisible)
tekstueel_bewijs: The apocalypse of God comes to us with life-transforming force.
God has ripped apart the curtain and permitted us to see.
God has numbered the days of your kingdom.

object.identificatie: Apocalyptic Vision / The Kingdom of God
tekstueel_bewijs: A radical alteration in our perception of the world.
His dominion is an everlasting dominion.
There is a God in heaven who reveals mysteries.
Produced for the encouragement of his people.
The lowly, humble servant of God.

helper.identificatie: Daniel / The Spirit of the Holy Gods
tekstueel_bewijs: There is in your kingdom a man in whom is the spirit of the holy gods.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a systemic, historical, and spiritual 'invasion' of evil that only God can judge.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The faithful community (The Catholic Worker) bears witness to God's reality in the dark.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Worker
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is a response to the primary program (God's invasion/revelation).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has ripped apart the curtain.
God would vindicate the loyalty of his servants.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We read the Bible for many years.

voorbeelden: God's invading grace that enables us to see in the dark.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Apocalyptic Transvision'—the gift of knowing/seeing reality as it truly is under God's reign, which then grants the 'Pouvoir' (power) to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (apparent power) to ~S1 (assimilation) to S1 (God's invasion/revelation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'invasion' of God's grace which exposes the transience of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon acknowledges the lethal power of tyrants.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon calls for witness, the engine is entirely theocentric. God is the one who invades, reveals, and judges. Human action is a 'bearing witness' to a reality God has already established.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: May we bear our witness... 'There was a man!'

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of History
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Most High rules the kingdom of men.
It is God’s invading grace that enables us to see in the dark.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Daniel is used as a model of faithfulness, but his competence is explicitly linked to the 'spirit of the holy gods' and God's revelation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by focusing on the God who reveals mysteries to Daniel.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Encouragement and 'transvision'—relief that the current political powers are not ultimate.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical Daniel to the modern Catholic Worker is seamless because of the shared actantial structure of 'marginalized witness vs. empire'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of God's rule and the 'not yet' of Belshazzar's apparent persistence.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God's power cannot be thwarted... God would vindicate the loyalty of his servants.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Savoir' (knowledge) and 'Pouvoir' (power) to resist.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'this present evil age' and 'megalomania' of empires.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of the primary program (Revelation/Judgment), and humans are the Subjects of the secondary program (Witness).

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current identification with the 'lowly' who receive God's revelation.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the Spirit's power to the specific acts of the Catholic Worker (feeding, housing) as a divine 'can-do' rather than just a human 'must-do'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats the opponent as a cosmic/systemic threat.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Keep the current order: God's Sovereignty → Human Witness.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how to preach ethics without falling into moralism by grounding human action in the prior 'apocalyptic' action of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on Rutledge's use of the 'thread' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the 'thread' is actually a Subject-shift from man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Daniel 5; Greimas shows how the hearer is functionally placed into the same actantial slot as the Hasidim.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Apocalyptic' is not a genre here but a modal transformation (from ignorance to Savoir-faire).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by making Daniel's competence dependent on God's spirit.
